channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Anthropic’s Claude AI Has 1 Killer Use Case, According to New Data
item.description: People are leveraging the power of Claude AI to get more done, and there’s one kind of task it’s especially good at.

item.title: The Fed’s September Rate Cut Marks Its First Move of the AI Era
item.description: The Fed must navigate the deflationary force of AI and the muted inflationary impact of tariffs.

item.title: The economy is reliant on the ‘fortunes of the well-to-do’ says Moody’s—if the ultra-rich get nervy that means recession
item.description: Mark Zandi says of the rich: "If they turn more cautious, for whatever reason, the economy has a big problem."

item.title: Robert Redford says he worked at Yosemite National Park before making it in Hollywood, inspired by his first visit when he had ‘a mild case of polio’
item.description: Redford grew up to be a Hollywood icon, but his love of nature proved to play a big role in his career and legacy.

item.title: 4 policy solutions cities and states are using to tackle the microplastics problem
item.description: Microplastics seem to be everywhere—in the air we breathe, the water we drink, and the food we eat. They have turned up in human organs, blood , testi...

item.title: Can You Cut an Interview Short If the Candidate Is Obviously Wrong for the Job?
item.description: … and two other tricky workplace dilemmas.

item.title: 1 in 3 Americans have no emergency savings—while boomers’ $2,000 cushion dwarfs Gen Z’s $400, survey finds
item.description: Roughly one-third of Americans are not prepared for a financial emergency.

item.title: Apple just made a big mistake with macOS 26
item.description: On Monday, Apple released macOS 26, also known as macOS Tahoe, to the world. The new operating system is available to anyone with an Apple Silicon Mac...

item.title: Tim Cook says Apple’s $600 billion factory build out will create a ‘domino effect.’ But the tech giant still isn’t building iPhones in America
item.description: A manufacturer labor shortage and an “impossible-to-replicate” supply chain will keep the tech giant dependent on Asia factories, experts tell Fortune...

item.title: This roof is hiding a secret: sleek new wind turbines you can barely see
item.description: It’s getting harder to build large wind farms in the U.S. as the industry faces major political roadblocks . But a different kind of wind power could ...

item.title: AI scraping is inevitable. Can publishers turn it into revenue?
item.description: We all know AI is eating the internet, with bots scraping sites for content and not giving anything in return. This, of course, is the impetus behind ...

item.title: MAHA’s Bets on Beets: The Rush To Ditch Petroleum Food Dyes
item.description: Consumer packaged food and beverage brands are scrambling to find manufacturers specializing in alternatives to synthetic dyes.

item.title: Shark Tank’s Kevin O’Leary Shares His Secret to Investing in Crypto
item.description: O’Leary, aka ‘Mr. Wonderful,’ also revealed why his Labubu doll is a ‘priceless’ asset.

item.title: Trump is pushing for a ‘big cut’ from the Fed today—but he’s already on a losing streak
item.description: Trump failed to oust Fed Governor Lisa Cook and is unlikely to get the steep rate cut he demands, as Powell and the FOMC weigh weaker jobs data.

item.title: How California’s governor trumped Trump’s merch
item.description: Is there any way to wear a “Newsom Was Right About Everything!” hat, but ironically? Even if you’re an earnest fan, it’s still meant as a joke. Califo...
